page.title: 03Farming
page.content: The farming in this particular area is mainly dairy farming. Most of the land is intensively managed grasslands for grazing cattle. There are very few crops other than grass except for a few fields of silage or barley.The area is rather hilly and there are quite alot of sheep on the rough grazing. There is a small area of marsh land outside Milford where there are a lot of rushes.{There is also a {350 acre farm in Milford which {belonged to the mill. This was mainly {a dairy farm with 50 fresian cows {and 50 jersey cows ,they employed {about 13 people working for them. They {were paid about nine pounds per week. This farm is no longer working. Most other farms are smaller.
